Text: Thank you to those who have already voted for me and those who will today. Your vote is held in the highest regard. I hope we can create a new type of politics and begin the real work…to solve problems and ensure the health of our country, politics, and institutions. Thank you!

2/2 I believe in both classical liberalism and republicanism! I believe in the great America experiment! I believe we can and must do better! That begins with you! We need to vote well not just for your team or against the other! Please vote for Dr. Jette in the primary June 7th!

1/2 There is only one Republican today who is non-Trump, pro-choice, for sensible gun regulation, economically sound and for free markets, for expanding properly incentivized healthcare, and champion of school choice in this primary!

9/9 In the end, we need to have a better discussion as to why these deadly and preventable occurrences are still taking place. It begins with the adults in the room who are simply not being adult like.

8/8 3.We can have more effective background checks. 
4.We should ban all armed and tactical gear at least until one gets the proper training and licensing. This is not a right found in the US Constitution.
7/7 2. 2.We can agree with Red Flag laws as many states have passed and it has effectively taken out of the hands deadly weapons of those who are perceived to be a danger to others and themselves.

6/6 1. increasing the age to purchase, own, and carry a firearm. If, as many champion, this is a problem of mental health and we see a growing trend among members of younger generations who need help and proper health services, then it makes sense to increase the age to 21.
5/5 Albeit, not a complete list, these are some ideas to help address the issue of gun violence and mass shootings.
4/4 The belief systems of those I am running against is not only troublesome, but should be kept as far away from public office as possible!   https://t.co/meIziwrETw

3/3 Please watch and vote well this June 7th. Republicans, democrats, and independents can all vote in the Republican Primary. Below is one reason why! This debate was to be put on the radio and covered but you will see why it was archived away and not shared.

2/2 We are a nation that is in crisis. We can and must do better. There are steps we can take to move forward to help prevent tragedies caused by those who carry weapons that create such violence that should never be seen in a civilized society, except in times of war.

https://t.co/meIziwrETw. Please watch the attached debate on guns. I have been fighting in this Republican primary and I need your help! I am asking you to share, discuss, and to vote! I am running to do better and call firth our better angels!

Although I seek your vote, I care more that you vote well. June7th we all have an opportunity to put that which is good about politics back into our politics and we can move past winning and build a better community and better politics.  

Dr. Matt Jette

10/11

You each have a choice this election. Democratic candidates are themselves taking aim at Zinke. Well, why wait. You have an opportunity now, for like a cancer, it will be harder to treat the longer you wait! In short, November will be too late. You can be better now.

9/11

It is no secret that I am a center-right Republican. I even oscillated between which primary to run in. I’m simple an American voter who sees complexity, who sees parties as attempted to disguise that complexity to make things simple, immediate, and proximal to win!

8/11

The difference is that an opportunity to bring forth change may not exist or, it it does, the solution will have to be more than a simple vote because the problem will be much more broad and deep.

7/11

I’m asking republicans, democrats, and independents to vote well. Please vote in the Republican Primary and maybe we can turn the tide. For, if we do not, the politics you hate (i.e., the extreme partisanship and the narrow, shallow, and simple solutions) will continue.

6/11

I am asking for your help. Pass along, reach out, speak up. My message is a learned one and one I hope can illustrate we, even in the middle of all of this, can still be better. That is, we can still call forth our better angels.

5/11

Today, we are witnessing the effects of a certain type of politics. A politics of winning; one in which winning votes, donations, media attention overshadow, marginalize, even delete the politics of betterment.

4/11

Today, the nation is in crisis, the nation is need of care and it is up to us to put aside ready made demands and beliefs and begin a new discussion.

3/11

Today, I am running for U.S. Congress here in Montana. My goal is to win by seeking your vote. However, I will not seek your vote at the expense of pursuing truth. My goal is to restore our promise to answer the question whether man can govern himself well.

2/11

Today, we are bombarded by constant images and noise that make us frustrated, sad, irritable, afraid, even angry. 
As such, today, the American voter has failed to live up to the standard for which a healthy and enduring democracy demands and requires.

1/11

Today, our politics are more divisive than ever.
Today, every issue has become political. 
Today, we decide between teams than having substantive and honest discussions.

@JoJoFromJerz First, thank you for your posts! Second, I am saddened and that sadness grows each day. Events like these reveal a broken nation. Rather than have a discussion, many adhere to destructive beliefs, hold on to anger, and defend the indefensible.

@RyanZinke Do not let the numbers fool you. Part of what the game now is rests in having donors donate multiple times in smaller increments to bring that number down. Also, he is including negative donations and the matching funds from the WinRed PAC.

@mikejopek Do not let the numbers fool you. Part of what the game now is rests in having donors donate multiple times in smaller increments to bring that number down. Also, he is including negative donations and the matching funds from the WinRed PAC.

Finally, if that costs me votes and/or the primary then it’s costs me both. The purpose here is to be virtuous, wise, and good, not merely have one team beat another bc of a letter. I will sleep well, but for others that may not be the case; perhaps though they are used to that.

With that, I have been asked several times who I would support if I lost the Republican primary. So, let me be clear. If I do not win the Republican primary, I will not support or vote for Zinke! In fact, if Zinke wins, I will support and vote for the Democratic nominee.

My campaign has always been about ensuring America and American exceptionalism is protected and nurtured. I have and will always place country above party and with great effort and diligence place virtue, wisdom, and goodness above all else.

Our elections matter…you, I, we have the opportunity to put an end to this type of thinking so you, I, and we can be the symbol and the instrument of hope and freedom in the world! https://t.co/MjI8JW0L3x
I took the time to complete @Ballotpedia's candidate survey to share my vision and goals. You'll be able to see the responses on my profile shortly.

Trump is not nor has he been fit for office. Anyone who supports him or is supported by him is unfit as well. You may disagree with the other side, policies and positions, against another’s beliefs, but you can NEVER be against the meaning of American representative democracy! https://t.co/Nl3EyP4nbs

Part 7 - But, it is the Republican primary where we stop Zinke, we stop Trump, we restore what is good and virtuous about America, maybe along the way we save a political party as well. The time is now…
Part 6 - In short, there are good people running in this election and I know those running on the democratic side have their intentions and hearts in the right place. I thank you for running!

Part 5 - I am running against Zinke. I have been called a moderate, a democrat, a Reagan Republican, and countless other names. I do not care about the labels; just know I stand so that you can stand. Well, I am standing!

Part 4 - The trust and faith that made America great will be diminished, if not permanently deleted. It is a strategy designed to dismantle the very thing that has kept this great American experiment going; that is, trust in the system itself and trust in each other.

Part 3 - I want to say that American democracy is built for these moments, I hope I am not wrong. If I am wrong, then both Zinke and Trump will win in November, with devastating potentialities for our electoral and political systems.

Part 2 - If Zinke wins, if Trump wins, our representative democracy loses. If Zinke wins office, the people of Montana must know it happened on their watch and the shame of our political system will be on their hands.
Part 1 - I moved to Montana and I started a campaign to protect what is good about American democracy. I have sacrificed greatly since being here in the effort to stop bad people from winning.
